page.title: 12The Game Conservancy.
page.content: To the east of Fordingbridge, on the north bank of the River Avon, is Burgate Manor which is the headquarters of{The Game Conservancy. This is a research institute which undertakes studies and gives advice on the{conservation}of Britain's {gamebirds and mammals.}The Conservancy administers two other research laboratories; one in Buckinghamshire where waterfowl are studied and another in the Pennines where studies of Red Grouse are conducted. At {Fordingbridge,}work is centred on farmland species and currently scientists are employed to discover what type of woodlands are most suitable for breeding and harbouring {pheasants;}how the ever-increasing use of pesticides on cereals can be reduced to ensure the survival of the {native grey partridge;}and measuring
